org.drooms.api

Interface Game

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultGame, GameController

    public interface Game
    Represents a certain type of game, with its own rules and constraints.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addListener(GameProgressListener listener)
      Add a custom listener to the game.
      Playground buildPlayground(String name, File source)
      Deprecated.

    • Method Detail

      • buildPlayground

        Playground buildPlayground(String name,
                         InputStream source)
        Build the playground from an input stream. Specific instructions on how to structure this file will come from implementations of this class.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the new playground.
        source - Stream in question.
        Returns:
        Playground constructed from that stream.

      • buildPlayground

        @Deprecated
Playground buildPlayground(String name,
                                    File source)
        Deprecated. 
        Build the playground from a file. Specific instructions on how to structure this file will come from implementations of this class.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the new playground.
        source - File in question.
        Returns:
        Playground constructed from that file.

      • addListener

        boolean addListener(GameProgressListener listener)
        Add a custom listener to the game. Will be used next time play(Playground, Collection, File) is called.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener in question.
        Returns:
        True if added.

      • getReport

        GameProgressListener getReport()
        Retrieve the main report of this game, detailing the progress of the game.
        Returns:
        The report. Null when game not played before.

      • play

        Map<Player,Integer> play(Playground playground,
                       Collection<Player> players,
                       File reportFolder)
        Initialize the game and play it through. Will throw an exception in case of a repeated call of this method on the same class instance. May throw IllegalStateException if setContext(InputStream) wasn't called first.
        Parameters:
        playground - The playground on which this game will be played out.
        players - A list of players to participate in the game.
        reportFolder - Where to output data, if necessary.
        Returns:
        Points gained by each player.

      • removeListener

        boolean removeListener(GameProgressListener listener)
        Remove a previously addListener(GameProgressListener)ed listener. This listener will not for any subsequent calls to play(Playground, Collection, File).
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener in question.
        Returns:
        True if removed.

      • setContext

        void setContext(InputStream context)
        Sets the context for this game. The context should provide properties that the game should use to decide various situations.
        Parameters:
        context - Where do we load the game properties from.
